page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area of {Mawgan in Meneage }on the Lizard peninsula consists mainly of agricultural land. Central to the landscape are the villages of {Mawgan} and{Gweek}both of which are mentioned in the first Domesday Book. Although less than 2km apart,the villages are quite different in character.Mawgan being quiet,quaint and straggly with few amenties.Gweek,the ancient port of Helston is clustered around the river Helford.Although the river is silted up,the village has a role to play still,in trading. Pottry,coal,iron and pleasure craft all operate from here.The tourist trade is attracted to Gweek by the seal sanctuary-a refuge for injured and abandoned seals.Dominating the landscape is the R.N.A.S. Culdrose,the biggest helicopter base in Europe.An air day is held every year.
